marklogic.body: While goats could reduce the fuel loading in the area, the resource benefits are not the same as using fire. Fire does more to return nutrients back into the soil. Fire has been a natural part of the ecosystem along the Front Range, and as a result, many species respond better to fire than other types of treatments. I'd be curious about introducing invasive species when bringing in goats. Either way, the area is prime to Burn, with tall grasses that have been matted down to a depth of 6+ inches. High use increases the chance of an ignition, and it would be Off to the races. So at this point, something needs to be done - maybe goats are the answer.
